summary: The Carla Walker Act establishes a grant program to improve forensic activities, specifically focusing on DNA analysis and forensic genetic genealogy. It authorizes the Attorney General to award grants to eligible entities (states, law enforcement agencies, etc.) for using whole genome sequencing technology to generate investigative leads and for purchasing equipment. The Act mandates reports on the use of these technologies and a DOJ report to Congress on implementation and recommendations for forensic genetic genealogy.
